trial_identification.studytitle: The effect of Encircle graduated compression stockings on lower limb blood flow in seated adults.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A randomised controlled trial investigating the effect of Encircle below-knee merino graduated compression stockings on lower limb venous haemodynamics in seated adults with normal peripheral circulation.

interventions.interventions: A graduated below-knee compression stocking will be worn on one leg for approximately120 minutes by trial participants and lower limb blood flow will be measured by ultrasound at time (T) = 0, T = 30, T= 60 and T = 120 minutes after the participant dresses in the stocking.
interventions.comparator: No treatment - i.e. no stocking. Lower limb blood flow will also be measured by ultrasound in the other leg of each trial participant; so that each participant is their own control.

primaryOutcome.outcome: The change in peak venous velocity as asssessed by Doppler ultrasound in the popliteal vein.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: This will be assessed at baseline and after the trial participants have been seated for a 120 minute period.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: The change in mean venous velocity as asssessed by Doppler ultrasound in the popliteal vein.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: This will be assessed at baseline and after the trial participants have been seated for a 120 minute period.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: The change in vein diameter as asssessed by Doppler ultrasound in the popliteal vein.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: This will be assessed at baseline and after the trial participants have been seated for a 120 minute period.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: The change in total volume flow as asssessed by Doppler ultrasound in the popliteal vein.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: This will be assessed at baseline and after the trial participants have been seated for a 120 minute period.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: The level of compression exterted by the graduated compression stocking at the ankle, mid-calf and below knee, as measured by a Kikuhime Pressure Monitor.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: This will be assessed at baseline and after the trial participants have been seated for a 120 minute period.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Participants must be able to provide informed consent for participation.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: 1. A history of previous or current deep vein thrombosis; 2. Pregnancy; 3. History of previous or current peripheral vascular disease or any other lower limb abnormality that is considered by the study researcher to be inappropriate for the application of a graduated compression stocking; 4. Abnormal clinical examination of the lower limbs.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Prolonged seated immobility is a risk factor for the development of deep vein thrombosis (DVT). Graduated compression stockings represent a non-pharmacological approach in reducing the risk of DVT associated with prolonged seated immobility. The simplicity of their use and their minimal side effects have made them popular in preventative care, both in the hospital post operative setting and amongst travellers. This study plans to investigate the pressure profile and effect on blood flow in the lower legs of a newly developed below the knee graduated compression stocking manufactured using merino wool.
